Description: Shoulder fragment of large pottery black-figured vessel (amphora?); interior reserved; exterior: glazed above; below, animal frieze: two lions, back to back; incised rosettes in the field.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 224, no. 104)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 109, pl. XXXIV, no. 320.4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.216)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4666 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
